Package mazes

Definition and handling of rectangular mazes.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ActionAlice A modelisation of Alice Robot.
AliceContinuousDistanceState A view on a maze, as it can be perceived by a mobile robot, like Alice : Its coordinates x,y (for the supervisor LabAlice, but not used by the state itself) What it sees in the 4 orthogonal directions (forward, left, backward and right), as far as the first wall it sees Its orientation (N,E,S,W) (for the supervisor, not used by the state itself)
AliceDistanceState A view on a maze, as it can be perceived by a mobile robot, like Alice : Its coordinates x,y (for the supervisor LabAlice, but not used by the state itself) What it sees in the 4 orthogonal directions (forward, left, backward and right), at a maximal distance of two squares Its orientation (N,E,S,W) (for the supervisor, not used by the state itself)
AliceMaze A rectangular maze, with walls (and no treasure !)
AliceMazeContinuousDistance A rectangular maze, with walls (and no treasure !)
AliceMazeDistance A rectangular maze, with walls (and no treasure !)
AliceState A view on a maze, as it can be perceived by a mobile robot, like Alice : Its coordinates x,y (for the supervisor LabAlice, but not used by the state itself) What it sees in the 4 orthogonal directions (forward, left, backward and right) Its orientation (N,E,S,W) (for the supervisor, not used by the state itself)
Bouton  
composantLabyrinthe A basic cell in a maze : Free cell Walls Treasure (or way out)
LocalMazeState A local view of a maze state consists of : Its coordinates x,y (for the supervisor environment LocalVisionMaze, but not used by the state itself) What it sees in the 8 directions (wall, free, treasure) Its type : free, wall, treasure : coded into the associated Contraintes
LocalVisionMaze Standard rectangular maze : each position is either free, a wall, a treasure.
Maze Standard rectangular maze : each position is either free, a wall, a treasure.
MazeAction In mazes, an action is a move in 1 among 9 directions (real moves and stood still) : we code it with two integers : Horizontal move : -1, 0, 1 Vertical move : -1,0,1
MazeState A maze state consists of : Its coordinates x,y Its type : free, wall, treasure : coded into the associated Environment
 

Package mazes Description

Definition and handling of rectangular mazes. Three definitions of mazes :

  • Every agent knows its position into the maze (Labyrinthe, EtatLabyrinthe,ActionLabyrinthe)
  • Every agent knows what it sees in 8 directions (it also knows where the North is), and its distance to treasure (LabLocal,EtatLabLocal,ActionLabyrinthe
  • An agent only knows what is sees in front of it, backard, at its right and at its left. An agent can move forward or backward, turn left or right. There are no treasures : reward is given when moving forward (LabAlice,EtatAlice,ActionAlice)
